fields.name: harvest_year
fields.title: Year in which crop harvested
fields.description: Year in which the crop was harvested.

fields.name: strip
fields.title: strip
fields.description: Treatment strips which extend the whole length of the field and receive the different fertilizer and manure treatments (1-22). There is no Strip 4. Current Strip 21 also known as 2.1, 2a or 2A, current Strip 22 also known as 2.2, 2b or 2B. Strip 1 (Sections 2-7) was started in 1968.

fields.name: section
fields.title: Section number 1968 onwards
fields.description: Since 1968 the treatment strips have been divided into 10 Sections (0-9) some in in rotation with non-wheat crops (2-5, 7), the others in continuous wheat (0, 1, 6, 8 and 9). Only Sections 2-5 and 7 are shown here. See plans for further details.

fields.name: plot
fields.title: plot
fields.description: Unique whole plot number, determined by Strip (1-22) and Section (0-9) number

fields.name: section_1926-67
fields.title: section 1926-1967
fields.description: Previous Section name, 1926-1967. Originally five Sections (I-V).  1926-1954, Section I divided into IA and IB in 1955, Section V divided in VA and VB in 1955.

fields.name: fertilizer_code
fields.title: fertilizer and manure treatment code
fields.description: Code describing the fertilizer or manure applied in that harvest year

fields.name: crop
fields.title: crop
fields.description: Cropping in this harvest year:  forage maize, sown in the spring of this harvest year. See crop_types_data for more information on the other crops grown on Broadbalk (yield data not shown here).

fields.name: previous_crop
fields.title: previous crop
fields.description: Crop grown in previous harvest year: oats. See crop_types_data for more information.

fields.name: fym_factor_level
fields.title: FYM factor level
fields.description: Code for the farmyard manure (FYM) factor level applied in this harvest year

fields.name: fym_applied
fields.title: FYM applied
fields.description: Amount of farmyard manure (FYM) applied in this harvest year

fields.name: fym_date
fields.title: Date FYM applied
fields.description: Date farmyard manure (FYM) applied, usually in the autumn

fields.name: castor_meal_factor_level
fields.title: Castor meal factor level
fields.description: Code for the castor bean meal factor level applied in this harvest year. No castor bean meal applied to forage maize. Shows plots which received castor meal in the past, indicated as (C)

fields.name: n_factor_level
fields.title: N factor level
fields.description: Code for the inorganic nitrogen (N) fertilizer factor level applied in this harvest year

fields.name: n_timing
fields.title: Timing of fertilizer N
fields.description: When inorganic nitrogen fertilizer was applied:  The spring N is either applied as a single application in the seedbed (late April or May), or in two applications, in the seedbed and post-emergence (approximately May and June). No N is applied in the autumn to forage maize.

fields.name: spring1_n_kg/ha
fields.title: First spring fertilizer N amount
fields.description: Amount of N in first application of inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in the spring to this crop. This does not include N in FYM

fields.name: spring1_n_date
fields.title: First spring fertilizer N date
fields.description: Date first application of inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in the spring.

fields.name: spring2_n_kg/ha
fields.title: Second spring fertilizer N amount
fields.description: Amount of N in second application of inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in the spring to this crop. This does not include N in FYM

fields.name: spring2_n_date
fields.title: Second spring fertilizer N date
fields.description: Date second application of inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in the spring.

fields.name: total_fertilizer_n_amount
fields.title: Total inorganic nitrogen fertilizer N amount
fields.description: Total inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied in spring to this crop. This does not include N in FYM.

fields.name: p_factor_level
fields.title: P factor level
fields.description: Code for the phosphorous (P) fertilizer factor level applied in this harvest year

fields.name: p_amount
fields.title: P amount
fields.description: Total amount of inorganic P fertilizer applied in this harvest year. This does not include P in FYM.

fields.name: p_date
fields.title: P fertilizer application date
fields.description: Date inorganic P fertilizer applied in this harvest year.

fields.name: k_factor_level
fields.title: K factor level
fields.description: Code for the potassium (K) fertilizer factor level applied in this harvest year

fields.name: k_amount
fields.title: K amount
fields.description: Total amount of inorganic K fertilizer applied in this harvest year. This does not include K in FYM.

fields.name: k_date
fields.title: K fertilizer application date
fields.description: Date inorganic K fertilizer applied in this harvest year.

fields.name: na_factor_level
fields.title: Na factor level
fields.description: Code for the sodium (Na) fertilizer factor level applied in this harvest year

fields.name: na_amount
fields.title: Na amount
fields.description: Total amount of inorganic Na fertilizer applied in this harvest year. This does not include Na in FYM.

fields.name: na_date
fields.title: Na fertilizer application date
fields.description: Date inorganic Na fertilizer applied in this harvest year.

fields.name: mg_factor_level
fields.title: Mg factor level
fields.description: Code for the magnesium (Mg) fertilizer factor level applied in this harvest year

fields.name: mg_amount
fields.title: Mg amount
fields.description: Total amount of inorganic Mg fertilizer applied in this harvest year. This does not include Mg in FYM.

fields.name: mg_date
fields.title: Mg fertilizer application date
fields.description: Date inorganic Mg fertilizer applied in this harvest year.

fields.name: sow_date
fields.title: Sowing date
fields.description: Date the crop was sown, in the spring of the harvest year.

fields.name: harvest_date
fields.title: Harvest date
fields.description: Date the crop was harvested

fields.name: cultivar
fields.title: Cultivar
fields.description: Crop cultivar or variety

fields.name: dry_matter_%
fields.title: Dry matter %
fields.description: Percentage dry matter of the whole forage maize crop at harvest

fields.name: yield_100%dm
fields.title: Yield at 100% dry matter
fields.description: Harvested whole-crop yield at 100% dry matter, grown as a whole-crop for silage. The whole crop was removed, apart from the stubble. This includes, leaves, stems and immature cobs.

fields.name: note
fields.title: Note
fields.description: Whether notes are applied or not

resources.title: crop yield data
resources.description: The main data table containing annual forage maize (Zea mays) yield data for all plots, and details of all fertilizer and manure treatments, 1997-2017. Also other agronomic information, including sowing and harvest dates, amount, type and date of application of treatments, and cultivars. Forage maize was grown for whole-crop silage as part of the five year wheat>wheat>wheat>oats>maize rotation on Broadbalk rotational Sections 2-5 and 7, from 1997-2017.  Maize received the same fertilizer applications as wheat. The split N applications were divided into two applications, in seedbed and post-emergence (rather than three). No autumn N was applied on strips 17-18, 1985-2000. In 2013, forage maize yields may have been reduced, due to the accidental application of herbicide to the crop in June/July 2013.  The Broadbalk Wheat Experiment was started in autumn 1843 to investigate the effects of fertilizers containing N, P, K, Na and Mg in various combinations, and organic manure, on the yield of winter wheat grown continuously. The treatment STRIPS (3-22) extend the whole length of the field; each strip tests a different fertilizer or manure treatment. In 1926 the strips were divided into five SECTIONS (I-V), bare fallowed in sequence to control weeds. There were further divisions in 1955 making seven Sections (IA-VB). In 1968 the strips were divided into 10 SECTIONS (0-9) and Strip 1 (Sections 2-7 only) was added.  Each PLOT is a unique strip\section combination. Sections 0, 1, 8 and 9 remained in continuous winter wheat. In Sections 2-7 wheat was grown rotation with other arable crops (potatoes, beans, oats or forage maize) and fallow. In 1979 Section 6 reverted to continuous wheat. Yields of wheat and the other non-wheat crops are published separately. See notes and Broadbalk section_names.pdf for full details of layout and the cropping plans for details of the different crop rotations.

name: broadbalk-forage-maize-yields-1997-2017
title: Broadbalk forage maize yields 1997-2017
description:
### Abstract
Annual forage maize (*Zea mays*) whole-crop yields for each treatment plot of the Broadbalk Experiment, with details of all fertilizer and manure applications. Also other agronomic information, including sowing and harvest dates, and maize cultivars. Forage maize was grown for whole-crop silage as part of the five-year wheat>wheat>wheat>oats>maize rotation on Broadbalk rotational Sections 2-5 and 7, from 1997-2017.  

In 2013, forage maize yields may have been reduced, due to the accidental application of herbicide to the crop in June/July 2013.
### Methods
The [Broadbalk Wheat Experiment](experiment/rbk1)  was started in autumn 1843 to investigate the effects of fertilizers containing N, P, K, Na and Mg in various combinations, and organic manure, on the yield of winter wheat grown continuously. The treatment STRIPS extend the whole length of the field; each strip tests a different fertilizer or manure treatment. In 1926 the strips were divided into five SECTIONS (I-V), bare fallowed in sequence to control weeds. There were further divisions in 1955 making seven Sections (IA-VB). Each PLOT is a unique strip\section combination.  In 1968 the experiment was divided into ten SECTIONS (0-9), to allow the comparison of wheat grown continuously with wheat in a three or five-year rotation. Wheat is grown in rotation with other arable crops (forage maize, beans, potatoes or oats) and fallow in Sections 2-5 and 7. Wheat only is grown in the other sections.  Strip 1 was added in 1968, on Sections 2-7 only.  

Yields from wheat and non-wheat crops are published separately. See section_names.pdf for full details of layout and the cropping plans for details of the different crop rotations.
### Technical Info
Forage maize yields are shown at 100% dry matter. The percentage dry matter of the crop at harvest is also given, this ranges from 17-41%. The whole crop was cut, apart from the stubble.  
Maize received the same fertilizer applications as wheat. The split N applications were divided into two applications, in seedbed and post-emergence (rather than three). No autumn N was applied on strips 17-18, 1985-2000. 

Current strip 21 is also known as 2.1, 2a and 2A; current strip 22 is also known as 2.2, 2b and 2B.
### Other
We thank the many other [Rothamsted staff](info/credits) who have been involved in the production of this data, including farm staff, field recorders, laboratory staff and data recorders, too numerous to mention.
### Provenance
Whole-crop yields are from the BKFMAIZE dataset in the e-RA database. Treatment details were taken from the Rothamsted Yield Books, published each year with details of each experiment.
### Quality
In accordance with the Joint Code of Practice for Research at Rothamsted, data processing in e-RA follow rigorous standard operating procedures to ensure the quality and correctness of data collected in the field through to depositing in the e-RA database. To ensure quality control during data inputting, the data sets were typed on two separate occasions (double data entry). During the second typing (verification) the data values were compared with those typed on the earlier occasion, and any discrepancies were resolved before verification continued. This procedure also set out how to handle situations where the written records were illegible or ambiguous. This procedure avoided visual checking of data, which can be very inaccurate. Once the data were entered into e-RA, they were independently back-checked against the original data sheets.
